Hi all! I have a question regarding removing association labels through the API. I've built a flow that appends the correct role in our back-end as an association label in HubSpot.

When a role is changed in our backend, I would like this to also be reflected in HubSpot by removing the old association label, and append the new role as an association label. I can't seem to figure out how to remove an association label through the API. Using DELETE will completely remove the association which is not what I want. I want to keep the association, but just update the label.

Thanks in advance!

Hey team <@U05JWMFLSEP> and I were chatting and we were both wonderingâ€¦ anyone have an answer for this one?
> Weâ€™re hitting the HS search endpoint API rate limit.  The doc says itâ€™s max 4 per second â€¦ which sounds comical to me frankly.  The policy in the exception coming back is â€˜SECONDLYâ€™.
> 
> Do you know if this limit is global for entire portal instance â€¦ or specific to a given private app?  The doc is a little unclear on this I think.
Private Apps share their limits. Only public apps have their individual limits.

Thx for the reply Byron.  According to this document <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/usage-details> (w enterprise subscription) these limits are per private app.  Iâ€™d originally looked at <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/search> that was a little vague.

Think Iâ€™ve got it now â€¦ all limits including search endpoint are per private app / access token.

I know limits are per private app but since the search api has its own limit I wouldn't be surprised if that limit was shared for the all apps in the account. Either way always set an api limit handler.

You can use the Create endpoint in <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/associations|associations v4> to replace the whole association. It will remove any previous label or association since it uses the PUT method. It will also remove "Primary" labels.
You can get the association type ID from the url in the UI in the object associations page in settings (or by API)
Let me see what i can find out
